name: Love, Edith
description: An e-commerce website that sold hand-made women clothing. This project was requested by the client to maximize simplicity, page speed, and costs. We settled on using the JAMStack approach to build this project where I used Next.js on the frontend, Strapi as the CMS, and deployed to Netlify and Heroku.

name: Soil Life
description: An informational website that educates the public about soil life using JAMStack. This project initially started as a monolithic stack where static pages were served from an express node server using ejs templates. Final product was converted to React and used Google Sheets as a CMS.
